history.content:
Taking it right now. Projects are all done individually. Professor Sen has changed the course a lot so it is likely very different from past offerings (by both him and Hilfinger). It's still a pretty high workload, just not as high as 162 or probably previous iterations of this class/when Hilfinger teaches it from my understanding. The workload is more a lot of smaller projects and homeworks throughout the semester that have deadlines of between 1-2 weeks. Professor Sen has been good listening to student feedback on course pacing etc. so things might change a little for next semester.

Compared to the other upper division classes I've taken, definitely more workload than 188, 161, and 168, but less than 162. It's a little different than 162 though since 162 workload is concentrated in each of those big projects, while for this class there's always some work to do every week. Maybe around equal or a little less than 170.

children.subject: Thanks for the detailed response! How worthwhile is the class in your opinion? Do you enjoy it? Is the material interesting and relevant?

history.content:
i heard this semester it didn't, so i'm curious if that will be the case for next sem too

also, for people taking the class this sem, how is the workload compared to other upper divs?
history.subject: does cs164 require project partners for FA17?

history.content: i heard this semester it didn't, so i'm curious if that will be the case for next sem too
